page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO ST.IVES.
page.content: St.Ives is a small town of 10,000 people in the{Penwith}district of Cornwall. It lies on the north coast overlooking St.Ives Bay, about 15 miles from Lands End. To the west lie steep{cliffs}and small coves and inland rise the{granite hills}of the Penwith moors. The town takes its name from{St.Ia}, who is said to have crossed from Ireland on a leaf (coracle) in A.D.409 The original village, with its tiny cottages and narrow streets around the harbour and parish church, has grown inland up a steep valley. Originally a{fishing}village, St.Ives is today primarily a{holiday}resort, but still retains much of its character and tradition as shown in its Celtic place-names and ancient customs.
